page.title: 20CURRENT ISSUES IN ALKHAM
page.content:
Alkham is a dormitory village and is kept so by the conservation policy by which it is covered.Only infilling of housing is allowed and consquently few new people move into the village.The age of villagers is always increasing and this is reflected in the clubs and societies within the village. The road through the Alkham valley, the B2060 is too narrow for safety especially in the village itself but no plans are yet established to build a by-pass. Speculation about the future Channel Tunnel have given cause for some concern but as yet no plans definitely effect the village. In the near future little or no changes in the village are expected.
Work on the Alkham Valley area was undertaken by St.Mary's CEP School, Folkestone,Kent.
